bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite section 8 (1) (a), the grant administrator may accept an application for a grant filed after the last day of the tax year for which the grant is claimed if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the application is filed on or before the last day of the following tax year, and
the grant administrator is satisfied that the owner of the property in respect of which the grant is claimed was entitled to the grant on December 31 of the tax year for which the grant is claimed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt of an application for a grant, the grant administrator may do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve the application for the grant in the amount claimed;
approve the application for the grant in an amount that is different from the amount claimed;
deny the application for the grant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 14 days after making a determination under subsection (1) (b) or (c), the grant administrator must give to the applicant written reasons for the determination.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adjustment of grant by grant administrator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The grant administrator may adjust the amount of a grant approved under section 10 in respect of a property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the grant administrator is satisfied that the applicant for the grant is, in respect of the property, entitled to a grant in an amount greater than the amount previously approved, and
the grant administrator becomes aware of the entitlement on or before the last day of the tax year following the tax year for which the previously approved grant was claimed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a grant is adjusted under subsection (1) in respect of a property,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the grant administrator must give written notice of the adjustment to the applicant within 14 days after making the adjustment, and
for the purposes of this Act, the amount of the grant as adjusted is the amount of the grant approved under section 10 in respect of the property for the tax year for which the grant was claimed.

bcl:text.#text: If a grant is adjusted under subsection (1) in the tax year following the tax year for which the grant was claimed, section 14 (2) and (3)  applies to the difference between the amount of the previously approved grant and the amount of the grant as adjusted as if that difference were the entire amount of the grant approved.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Cancellation of grant by grant administrator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

means the grant in the amount to which the new applicant is entitled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), the grant administrator must cancel a grant approved under section 10 in respect of a property if, on or before the last day of the tax year following the tax year for which the grant was claimed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the grant administrator receives, in respect of the property, an application for a grant from a person other than the applicant for the grant previously approved, and

the grant administrator is satisfied that the person who filed the application referred to in paragraph (a) is, in respect of the property, entitled to a grant in an amount greater than the amount previously approved.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) does not apply if, in the tax year for which the new grant is claimed, the new applicant became an owner of the property in respect of which the new grant is claimed.
If a grant is cancelled under subsection (2) in respect of a property,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the grant administrator must, within 14 days after cancelling the grant, give written notice of the cancellation and the effect of that cancellation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the applicant for the previously approved grant, and
the new applicant,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant for the previously approved grant may not, for the tax year, receive a grant in respect of a different property,
for the purposes of this Act, only the new grant will be considered to have been made for the tax year in respect of the property, and

despite the cancellation, the previously approved grant applied or otherwise dealt with under this Act is deemed to have been applied or otherwise dealt with in relation to the new applicant as if the amount of the previously approved grant were part of an amount of the new grant.

bcl:text.#text: If a grant is cancelled under subsection (2) in the tax year following the tax year for which the grant was claimed, section 14 (2) and (3)  applies to the difference between the amount of the previously approved grant and the amount of the new grant as if that difference were the entire amount of the grant approved.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adjustment of grant after assessment change

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the grant administrator has made a determination under section 10 in respect of an application for a grant for a tax year,
an assessment of the property in respect of which the application was made is set aside or varied, and
the change in the assessment affects the amount of the property taxes on the property for the tax year to which the assessment relates.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If this section applies,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the collector of the jurisdiction in which the property is located must notify the grant administrator of the change in the amount of the property taxes on the property for the tax year to which the assessment relates, and
the grant administrator must again determine the amount of the grant, if any, to which the applicant for the grant was entitled for that tax year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The grant administrator may, at the grant administrator's discretion, direct the collector to recover from or refund to the applicant, as applicable, any difference between the amount of the grant previously approved for that tax year and the amount of the grant determined under subsection (2) (b).
If the grant administrator issues a direction under subsection (3),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the collector must comply with the direction, and

bcl:text.#text: sections 12 and 12.1 of this Act and section 124 (9)  of the  apply to the amount of the grant determined under subsection (2) (b) of this section as if that amount were a grant approved under section 10 of this Act in the tax year in which the determination is made.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Payment and Other Dealings with Grants

bcl:text.#text: To enable a municipality to exercise a power under section 124 (9)  of the  or to perform a duty under this Act, the grant administrator must, subject to the regulations, report to the municipality information relating to grants approved under section 10 of this Act in respect of the properties located within the municipality.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations, a municipality must report to the grant administrator the information that the grant administrator requires to administer or enforce this Act, including, without limitation, information about the property taxes on the properties located within the municipality.

On or before the fifth business day in March of each tax year, a municipality must certify to the grant administrator, in the form and manner required by the grant administrator, that, in respect of property located within the municipality,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each grant approved under section 10 for the previous tax year has been applied or otherwise dealt with by the municipality in accordance with this Act, and
the total amount of all grants approved under section 10 for the previous tax year has been applied or otherwise dealt with by the municipality in accordance with this Act.

bcl:text: On receipt of the certification referred to in section 12 (3), the minister must pay to a municipality, out of the consolidated revenue fund, a positive amount, if any, equal to
less

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total amount of all grants approved under section 10 for the previous tax year in relation to property located in the municipality

bcl:text.#text: the total amount of all grants deducted by that municipality, under section 124 (9)  of the , from taxes payable for that previous tax year under section 124 (2) of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For any purpose related to the administration of this Act, the grant administrator or a person authorized by the grant administrator, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: during normal office hours enter any place where the records of a municipality are kept, and
inspect any records that relate or may relate to a grant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not obstruct anyone conducting an inspection under subsection (1).
Subsection (1) does not authorize anyone to enter a room used as a dwelling without the occupier's consent.

If a grant is approved in respect of a property in the tax year for which the grant is claimed, a municipality, or, if the property is located outside a municipality, the minister, may refund to the owner of the property the amount, if any, by which the total amount of any payments made by the owner in respect of property taxes for the tax year exceeds the sum of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of the property taxes for the tax year less the amount of the grant;
any outstanding taxes on the property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, in respect of a property located within a municipality, a grant is approved in the tax year following the tax year for which the grant is claimed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister must pay to the municipality an amount equal to the amount of the grant approved, and
the municipality must pay to the owner of the property the surplus, if any, after applying the amount received from the minister under paragraph (a) to any outstanding taxes on the property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, in respect of a property located outside a municipality, a grant is approved in the tax year following the tax year for which the grant is claimed, the minister must pay to the owner of the property a positive amount, if any, equal to the amount of the grant less any outstanding taxes on the property.
An amount paid by the minister under this section must be paid out of the consolidated revenue fund.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How grants are to be applied by municipalities

bcl:text.#text: Despite the  or the , a municipality must apply all amounts received under section 12.1  of this Act in respect of a tax year and credit all amounts deducted under section 124 (9)  of the  as a payment towards property taxes on the eligible residence, the eligible building, the land cooperative or the multi dwelling leased parcel for the tax year for which the grants were approved under section 10  of this Act and in the amount that they were approved.

If a municipality establishes a tax collection scheme under section 235  of the  and amounts are paid in accordance with the scheme before July 2 in the year, for the purposes of this Act, those amounts are deemed to be part of the property taxes for the tax year and are to be considered part of the liability for those property taxes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For property taxes to which subsection (1) applies, if all or part of the amount of a grant remains unapplied after the grant is dealt with in accordance with section 15, the municipality must deal with the unapplied amount in accordance with section 14 (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The grant administrator may request any information or records, or make any inquiries, the grant administrator considers necessary for the purpose of auditing a person's entitlement to a grant approved under this Act.
Information or records requested under subsection (1) must be given to the grant administrator within 30 days after the date of the request.

If the grant administrator determines that an applicant for a grant was, for a tax year, entitled to a grant in an amount greater than the amount of the grant approved, subject to subsection (4), the grant administrator may refund to the applicant, out of the consolidated revenue fund, an amount equal to the difference.

bcl:text.#text: Subsection (3) does not apply after the last day of the sixth tax year following the tax year for which a grant is claimed except in relation to a determination made under section 10.3 (2) (b) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determination — not entitled to grant or supplement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if the grant administrator determines that a person received an amount as a grant or supplement that the person was not entitled to receive, the grant administrator must, within 14 days after making the determination, give to the person a notice that includes all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the reasons for the determination;
the amount the person is required to pay and the date by which the amount must be paid;
information about the person's right, under section 17.15, to a review of the determination;
the methods by which payment may be enforced under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to an amount received in a tax year that is more than 6 years before the tax year in which the determination is made unless the determination is made under section 10.3 (2) (b).
Subject to section 17.13, a notice recipient must pay to the government, on or before the date set out in the notice of disentitlement, the total of the following amounts:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of the grant or supplement the grant administrator determined the notice recipient was not entitled to receive;
interest on the amount referred to in paragraph (a) from the date of the approval of the grant or supplement to the date of the notice of disentitlement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 17.13, if the notice recipient does not pay, on or before the date set out in the notice of disentitlement, the total amount referred to in subsection (1) of this section, the notice recipient must also pay to the government interest on the unpaid amount, including unpaid interest, from the date of the notice of disentitlement.
In this section:

bcl:text.#text: Despite the  but subject to this section, the grant administrator may, within one year after the date of the notice of disentitlement, waive or cancel all or part of an amount otherwise payable by a notice recipient under section 17.12.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (4), if the grant administrator is satisfied that it is fair and reasonable to do so, the grant administrator may, in the following circumstances, waive or cancel all or part of an amount otherwise payable by a notice recipient under section 17.12:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: both of the following circumstances apply:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount relates to a grant or supplement received by the notice recipient in respect of a residence for a tax year in which no person met the applicable principal residence requirement for the residence;

the grant administrator is satisfied that, had the notice recipient applied for the grant or supplement in respect of another residence, the applicable principal residence requirement would have been met and the grant approved or supplement paid;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the circumstances, if any, established by regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A waiver or cancellation under subsection (3) is subject to the prior approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council if the amount to be waived or cancelled is greater than $25 000.

The grant administrator may also waive or cancel all or part of an amount of interest otherwise payable by a notice recipient under section 17.12 if the grant administrator is satisfied that the notice recipient, in applying for a grant or supplement, relied on incorrect advice or information provided by a person who was employed by, or retained under a contract to perform services for, the government.
The grant administrator must give to a notice recipient written notice of a waiver or cancellation under this section.
If a notice recipient has paid an amount that is subsequently waived or cancelled under this section, the grant administrator must pay to the notice recipient, from the consolidated revenue fund,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a refund of the amount paid by the notice recipient, and
interest on the amount refunded from the date of the payment to the government to the date of the refund.

bcl:text.#text: A notice recipient may request a review of a determination made by the grant administrator other than a determination made under section 10.3 (2) (b) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The request for review must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in writing,
be given to the minister within 90 days after the date of the notice of disentitlement, and
clearly set out a statement of all material facts and the reasons in support of the review.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receiving a request for review, the minister must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: consider the matter,
confirm, vary or reverse the determination made by the grant administrator, and
promptly give to the notice recipient written notice of the decision on the review.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may, in writing, delegate to a named person or to a class of persons any of the minister's duties under subsection (3).

If, as a result of the review, the minister reduces an amount set out in the notice of disentitlement or reverses a determination made by the grant administrator, the grant administrator must pay to the person, out of the consolidated revenue fund,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a refund of any excess amount, including interest, paid by the person, and
interest on the amount referred to in paragraph (a) from the date the person paid the amount to the government to the date of the refund.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The date on which a request for review is given to the minister under subsection (2) (b) is the date it is received by the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Court proceedings to recover amount owing

bcl:text.#text: The government may commence a proceeding in a court of competent jurisdiction to recover an amount owing to the government under section 17.12  as a debt due to the government.
If a person fails to pay an amount owing to the government under section 17.12 , the grant administrator may issue a certificate specifying the amount owed and the name of the person who owes it.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The grant administrator may file with the Supreme Court a certificate issued under subsection (1).

A certificate filed under subsection (2) has the same force and effect, and all proceedings may be taken on the certificate, as if it were a judgment of the court in favour of the government for the recovery of a debt in the amount specified in the certificate against the person named in the certificate.

If the amount specified in a certificate filed under subsection (2) is different from the actual amount owing to the government under section 17.12, the grant administrator may correct the amount by issuing a new certificate specifying the revised amount owed and the name of the person who owes it.
The grant administrator may file with the Supreme Court a certificate issued under subsection (4).
A certificate filed under subsection (5)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: revises the certificate filed under subsection (2) that names the same person,
is deemed to be filed at the same time as the certificate it revises, and

has the same force and effect, and all proceedings may be taken on the certificate, as if it were a judgment of the court in favour of the government for the recovery of a debt in the amount specified in the certificate against the person named in the certificate.

bcl:text.#text: Remedies available to the government, other than the remedy under section 17.17 , for the recovery of an amount owing to the government under section 17.12  may be exercised separately, concurrently or cumulatively.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The liability of a person for the payment of an amount owing to the government under section 17.12 is not affected by a fine or penalty imposed on or paid by the person for contravention of this Act.

Without limiting subsection (2), if the grant administrator knows or suspects that a person is about to advance money to or make a payment on behalf of a debtor, or make a payment in respect of a negotiable instrument issued by a debtor, the grant administrator may demand that that person pay to the government, on behalf of the debtor's liability under section 17.12, the money that would otherwise be advanced or paid.

If, under this section, the grant administrator demands that a person pay to the government, on account of a debtor's liability under section 17.12, money otherwise payable by that person to the debtor as interest, rent, remuneration, a dividend, an annuity or other periodic payment, the demand

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is applicable to all of those payments to be made by the person to the debtor until the liability under section 17.12 is satisfied, and

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How and when documents are given by grant administrator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, under this Act, a document must or may be given by the grant administrator to a person, other than a municipality, the document may be given as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person is an individual, by leaving the document with the individual;
if the person is a corporation, by leaving the document with a board member or senior officer of the corporation;
if the person is an extraprovincial corporation, by leaving the document with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a person referred to in paragraph (b), or
an attorney for the extraprovincial corporation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by sending the document by ordinary mail or registered mail to the last known address of the person according to the records of the grant administrator;
by sending the document by electronic mail to the last known electronic mail address of the person according to the records of the grant administrator;
by sending the document by fax to the last known fax number of the person according to the records of the grant administrator;
by sending the document by another communication method agreed to by the person and the grant administrator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person carries on business under a name or style other than the person's own name or style, a document to be given in accordance with this section may be addressed to the name or style under which the person carries on business.

A document sent by ordinary mail, registered mail, electronic mail, fax or a communication method referred to in subsection (1) (g) is conclusively deemed to have been given on the date the document was sent.

Despite subsection (3), if a notice of disentitlement is sent by ordinary mail, registered mail, electronic mail or fax, the notice, for the purposes of this Act, is deemed to have been given on the date of that notice.
